page.title: 09The Temperance Walk
page.content: The{first}walk was in the beginning of the{19th}Century.It was originally a{temperance}walk but now it's a traditional part of village custom. There are actually{three}walks, {Inverallochy,Cairnbulg,}and the{ {St.Combs}one which nearly everyone attends.In the past around fifty people played in the band,with walkers behind.The oldest men of the village would lead the walk then there would be the band.They stop at the doors of ill and very old people and play any request from the relatives. There are not very many places outside {Buchan}which know about our walks. Fluting classes are held for young people to carry on the tradition.After the walk we go home and we have our dinner.As the{Inverallochy}walk is on {Christmas}day they have a{Walk Dinner} instead of a{Christmas}one.
